dialogueLines: This place smells like happiness, doesn’t it? I swear, if I could live inside a cappuccino, I would.
Oh, by the way, I tried making coffee at home yesterday. Total disaster — I somehow made coffee taste like burnt toast.
You remember my cat, Momo? He literally dipped his paw in my mug and then walked all over the counter like a caffeine addict.
Anyway, this café reminds me of when I was in Goa last summer.
There was this tiny café near the beach — the owner had named all his drinks after emotions!
‘Espresso of Anger,’ ‘Mocha of Joy,’ I had the ‘Cappuccino of Regret.’ Don’t laugh — it was actually good!
I think I’ll try something new here next time, maybe the Hazelnut Mocha.
What about you — oh wait, I forgot you don’t talk much, huh?
I like that though… quiet boys usually remember everything we say. Or at least they should.

questions.questionText: What did I accidentally make my coffee taste like?
questions.correctResponse: Right! Burnt toast — my proud barista fail.
questions.wrongResponse: Nope! It was burnt toast, not whatever you guessed.

questions.questionText: Who dipped their paw in my coffee?
questions.correctResponse: Correct! Momo the cat was the caffeine criminal.
questions.wrongResponse: No… it was Momo, my cat! You forgot the troublemaker?

questions.questionText: What was special about the café in Goa I mentioned?
choices: It had drinks named after emotions
questions.correctResponse: Right! Every drink was named after emotions. ‘Espresso of Anger’ was my favorite name.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I said the drinks were named after emotions!

questions.questionText: What drink did I say I had in that Goa café?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! The legendary ‘Cappuccino of Regret.’ I swear it tasted like heartbreak and cinnamon.

questions.questionText: What did I say I like about you?
questions.correctResponse: Right! I said I like that you’re quiet… mysterious types always win hearts.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I said I like your quietness. Don’t make me change my mind!
